page.title: 04CONCERN FOR THORNBURY
page.content:
{Concern for Thornbury}has over 200 members. It was founded by Charles and Sheila Eardley-Wilmot over ten years ago. They are still committee members and are also now town and district councillors. Concern is{not just a conservation {society,}it regularly looks at new planning applications, and comments to the planning authority if any proposal is likely to have a detrimental effect on the town or the surrounding area. Design of new shop fronts, unsuitable trade signs, retention of old buildings,tree planting schemes and preservation of trees are just some of the issues which are dealt with by Concern in{its aim to preserve the {character of Thornbury.}
Compiled by 10-11 year olds, aided by Mrs Diane Vizard (parent).
